enb_long_title: Tenth Subsidiary Body for Scientific and Technological Advice (SBSTA) and the Subsidiary Body for Implementation (SBI)
sentences: 'Delays, delays, delays' was how several observers summarized the meeting thus far.
Some suggested that the deceptively distant deadlines for decisions are feeding the temptation to leave substantive discussions to the last minute.
A number said a sense of lethargy was inevitable following the heady days of Kyoto, while others cited increasingly poor prospects for ratification by the US as a cause of hesitation.
An EU delegate remarked that the participants should 'get the environment and emotion back into the debate because it is getting very depressing.

' With the meeting entering its final days, some predicted that progress at COP-5 will be patchy at best, with the modest advances likely on guidelines for Annex I national communications offset by the snails pace of talks on LULUCF and mechanisms.
Other delays took on a more ominous tone, as evidenced by a bomb threat to the Secretariat headquarters and a second bomb threat to the Maritim.
